item.title: The Week in Ransomware - June 16th 2023 - Wave of Extortion
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The MOVEit Transfer extortion attacks continue to dominate the news cycle, with the Clop ransomware operation now extorting organizations breached in the attacks. [...]

item.title: Police cracks down on DDoS-for-hire service active since 2013
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Polish police officers part of the country's Central Cybercrime Bureau detained two suspects believed to have been involved in the operation of a long-running DDoS-for-hire service (aka booter or stresser) active since at least 2013. [...]

item.title: Google targets fake business reviews network in new lawsuit
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Google has filed a consumer protection lawsuit against Ethan QiQi Hu and his company, Rafadigital, accusing him of creating 350 fraudulent Business Profiles and 14,000 fake reviews for an alleged business verification service for Google services. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 KB5027231 also breaks Chrome for Cisco, WatchGuard EDR users
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Windows 11 22H2 KB5027231 cumulative update released during this month's Patch Tuesday also breaks Google Chrome on systems protected by Cisco and WatchGuard EDR and antivirus solutions. [...]

item.title: Western Digital boots outdated NAS devices off of My Cloud
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Western Digital is warning owners of My Cloud series devices that can no longer connect to cloud services starting on June 15, 2023, if the devices are not upgraded to the latest firmware, version 5.26.202. [...]

item.title: Millions of Oregon, Louisiana state IDs stolen in MOVEit breach
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Louisiana and Oregon warn that millions of driver's licenses were exposed in a data breach after a ransomware gang hacked their MOVEit Transfer security file transfer systems to steal stored data. [...]

item.title: Rhysida ransomware leaks documents stolen from Chilean Army
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Threat actors behind a recently surfaced ransomware operation known as Rhysida have leaked online what they claim to be documents stolen from the network of the Chilean Army (EjÃ©rcito de Chile). [...]

item.title: MOVEit Transfer customers warned of new flaw as PoC info surfaces
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Progress warned MOVEit Transfer customers to restrict all HTTP access to their environments after info on a new SQL injection (SQLi) vulnerability (tracked as CVE-2023-35708) was shared online today. [...]

item.title: Suspected LockBit ransomware affiliate arrested, charged in US
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Russian national Ruslan Magomedovich Astamirov was arrested in Arizona and charged by the U.S. Justice Department for allegedly deploying LockBit ransomware on the networks of victims in the United States and abroad. [...]

item.title: Android GravityRAT malware now steals your WhatsApp backups
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new Android malware campaign spreading the latest version of GravityRAT has been underway since August 2022, infecting mobile devices with a trojanized chat app named 'BingeChat,' which attempts to steal data from victims' devices. [...]

item.title: Clop ransomware gang starts extorting MOVEit data-theft victims
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The Clop ransomware gang has started extorting companies impacted by the MOVEit data theft attacks by listing them on a data leak site, a common extortion tactic used as a precursor for the public leaking of stolen data. [...]

item.title: Traditional Pen Testing vs. PTaaS with Web Application Security
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Outpost24
item.description: While traditional pen testing has been the go-to method for finding security gaps, a new approach has emerged: Penetration Testing as a Service (PTaaS). Learn more from Outpost24 on PTaaS and its advantages over traditional pen testing. [...]

item.title: Barracuda ESG zero-day attacks linked to suspected Chinese hackers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A suspected pro-China hacker group tracked by Mandiant as UNC4841 has been linked to data-theft attacks on Barracuda ESG (Email Security Gateway) appliances using a now-patched zero-day vulnerability. [...]
